//Determine if the value is negative
IF SUM([Sales]) < 0 THEN '-' ELSE '' END
+
'$' //Dolar Symbol
+

//Get Int Amount by Dividing the Value by its' Base 1000 Value
STR(INT(ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/POWER(1000,INT(LOG(  ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/10,0)*10 ,1000))),1)))

+

//Determine the Unit to display based on the Log Base 1000
CASE INT(LOG(ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/10,0)*10,1000)) //Unit Symbol
WHEN 1 THEN 'K'
WHEN 2 THEN 'M'
WHEN 3 THEN 'B'
WHEN 4 THEN 'T'
ELSE ''
END

//Determine if the value is negative
IF SUM([Sales]) < 0 THEN '-' ELSE '' END
+
'$' //Dolar Symbol
+

//Get Int Amount by Dividing the Value by its' Base 1000 Value
STR(INT(ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/POWER(1000,INT(LOG(  ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/10,0)*10 ,1000))),1)))
+

//Determine if you need to show a decimal
//If the Modulo is zero, we just want to show blank (Ex 159.0K = 159K)
//Else we want to show the decimal value (Ex 159.4K)
IF (ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/POWER(1000,INT(LOG(ABS(SUM([Sales])),1000))),1)*10)%10 = 0 THEN ''
ELSE '.' + STR((ROUND(ABS(SUM([Sales]))/POWER(1000,INT(LOG(ABS(SUM([Sales])),1000))),1)*10)%10)
END
+

//Determine the Unit to display based on the Log Base 1000

WHEN 1 THEN 'K'
WHEN 2 THEN 'M'

WHEN 4 THEN 'T'
ELSE ''
END

-ZN(IF YEAR([Order Date])=[Parameters].[Parameter 1]-1 THEN [Sales] ELSE NULL END)))
/ (SUM(ZN(IF YEAR([Order Date])=[Parameters].[Parameter 1]-1 THEN [Sales] ELSE NULL END)))
